pageContext.claim: “I consulted with everybody. I always consult with everybody [about his decisions in Syria]. If you remember, about eight months ago, I talked about doing this. And we kept 2,000 people there, and then slowly brought them out. But once we captured ISIS, I didn't see -- I don't want to stay there for the next 40 years. It's not going to do anything.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. Many Republicans said they were caught off guard by the president's decision to allow Turkey to invade areas of Syria held the U.S. Kurdish allies and Republicans have widely criticized this move.
